channel.title: CVE Feed for rogierlankhorst -- Burst Statistics – Privacy-Friendly Analytics for WordPress
channel.description: The latest CVEs for rogierlankhorst -- Burst Statistics – Privacy-Friendly Analytics for WordPress

item.title: CVE-2023-5761|2024-08-02T08:07:32.680Z -- rogierlankhorst -- burst%20statistics%20%E2%80%93%20privacy-friendly%20analytics%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Burst Statistics – Privacy-Friendly Analytics for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'url' parameter in versions 1.4.0 to 1.4.6.1 (free) and versions 1.4.0 to 1.5.0 (pro) due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

item.title: CVE-2024-1894|2024-06-04T18:00:05.149Z -- rogierlankhorst -- burst%20statistics%20%E2%80%93%20privacy-friendly%20analytics%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Burst Statistics – Privacy-Friendly Analytics for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the 'burst_total_pageviews_count' custom meta field in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.6.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. Note that this exploit only functions if the victim has the 'Show Toolbar when viewing site' option enabled in their profile.

item.title: CVE-2024-1894|2024-08-01T18:56:22.716Z -- rogierlankhorst -- burst%20statistics%20%E2%80%93%20privacy-friendly%20analytics%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The Burst Statistics – Privacy-Friendly Analytics for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the 'burst_total_pageviews_count' custom meta field in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.6.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. Note that this exploit only functions if the victim has the 'Show Toolbar when viewing site' option enabled in their profile.
